<title>Live 1975-85 | Bruce Springsteen</title>
<meta name="description" content="Clocking in at 40 songs and 3 CDs (and five vinyl records!), this insanely anticipated career-spanning set was a treasure chest for fans thirsting for a document of ten years of E Street shows." />
<meta name="robots" content="index, follow, max-snippet:-1, max-image-preview:large, max-video-preview:-1" />
<link rel="canonical" href="https://brucespringsteen.net/albums/live1975-85/" />
<meta property="og:locale" content="en_US" />
<meta property="og:type" content="article" />
<meta property="og:title" content="Live 1975–85" />
<meta property="og:description" content="Clocking in at 40 songs and 3 CDs (and five vinyl records!), this insanely anticipated career-spanning set was a treasure chest for fans thirsting for a document of ten years of E Street shows. Bonus: It includes cuts such as "Fire" and "Because the Night," live favorites that had yet to see the light of day on an official release." />
<meta property="og:url" content="https://brucespringsteen.net/albums/live1975-85/" />

<meta name="twitter:site" content="@springsteen" />

yoast_head_json.title: Live 1975-85 | Bruce Springsteen
yoast_head_json.description: Clocking in at 40 songs and 3 CDs (and five vinyl records!), this insanely anticipated career-spanning set was a treasure chest for fans thirsting for a document of ten years of E Street shows.
yoast_head_json.og_description: Clocking in at 40 songs and 3 CDs (and five vinyl records!), this insanely anticipated career-spanning set was a treasure chest for fans thirsting for a document of ten years of E Street shows. Bonus: It includes cuts such as "Fire" and "Because the Night," live favorites that had yet to see the light of day on an official release.
yoast_head_json.twitter_description: Clocking in at 40 songs and 3 CDs (and five vinyl records!), this insanely anticipated career-spanning set was a treasure chest for fans thirsting for a document of ten years of E Street shows. Bonus: It includes cuts such as "Fire" and "Because the Night," live favorites that had yet to see the light of day on an official release.
